CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1945, pg. 16, reads: "Lead U. S. League - Rolling along at a merry clip, the Pittsburgh Crawfords (above) risk the leadership of the new United States League here Sunday, July 1, when they battle the strong Chicago Brown Bombers at Forbes Field. The Crawfords won a doubleheader from Brooklyn last Sunday to gain a firm hold on first place. - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1976, pg. 41, reads: "Pittsburgh Crawfords - One of the greatest teams in baseball history was the Pittsburgh Crawfords.  They were started by the man who was the binding force behind the second Negro National League, Gus Greenlee who was from Pittsburgh. - Teenie Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Crawfords baseball team posed in dugout at Forbes Field
